eye dictionary

laby eyeorb's guide to words

yaya (alternate forms: uaua, yeya, yayayaya)

  • a combination of "yay" and "yess"
  • a word akin to the action of nodding and understanding when someone is saying something agreeable
  • usually for lighthearted contexts

icey (alternate forms: iey, ie, e, isey, ici)

  • means "i see"
  • lighthearted alternate form of "i see" - used for nodding and understanding as well
  • for lighthearted contexts

slop (alternate forms: slop hazard, grey goo slop, popuslop, [thing]slop, slop alert, pig slop, etc)

  • means something stupid and bad
  • dislike dislike
  • for contexts where you talk about things you dont like

oumajgad

  • means "oh my god"
  • when you view something exciting
  • for contexts where you say WHATTT OUMAJGAD...
  • the j is pronounced like a y

tenkjuu (alternate forms: sankjuu, sankyuu)

  • means "thank you"
  • combination of japanese people saying thank you + european j pronounced as y
  • hehehehehe
